intro: Sivadasania josephiana, commonly known as the Joseph's sivadasania, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other related species. The plant is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
